conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict whether it flows into container E or F after passing through baffles.
The liquid from A flows downward and hits the pink baffle.
The pink baffle is slanted, directing the liquid to the left.
The liquid then flows onto the cyan baffle, which is also slanted to the left.
The cyan baffle directs the liquid into container E.
The liquid from B flows downward and hits the pink baffle.
The pink baffle is slanted, directing the liquid to the left.
The liquid then flows onto the cyan baffle, which is also slanted to the left.
The cyan baffle directs the liquid into container E.
The liquid from C flows downward and hits the green baffle.
The green baffle is slanted, directing the liquid to the right.
The liquid then flows onto the cyan baffle, which is slanted to the right.
The cyan baffle directs the liquid into container F.
The liquid from D flows downward and hits the white baffle.
The white baffle is slanted, directing the liquid to the right.
The liquid then flows directly into container F.
Liquids from A and B flow into container E, and liquids from C and D flow into container F.
